Simon.Action: Politely says 'Sorry' when pushed by others in a crowded subway.
Does not retaliate or respond aggressively when a hostile man raises his middle finger at him on the subway.
Gets up and stands by a hand rail when asked to give up a seat without confrontation.
Looks at his reflection with a ghostly, half-formed expression indicating uncertainty or lack of self-confidence.
Politely says 'Sorry' when bumped and pushed by others instead of asserting himself.
Fights against the crowd to try to get out of the train despite the pushing and lack of apology from others.
Smiles at Hannah and follows her into the building.
Appears nervous and surprised when challenged by the guard, then complies by signing in.
Attempts to use his card to bypass sign-in but when it fails, does not argue and cooperates.
Keeps eyes lowered and navigates a mostly empty street, dodging others to avoid collisions.
Attempts to enter office building using card, but it doesn't work; looks surprised and nervous when stopped by guard.
Initially claims to work there and shows confidence in name recognition, but ultimately submits to signing in as a visitor.
Greets coworkers hesitantly but is ignored.
Tries to correct guard politely but trails off when ignored.
Sits quietly alone in a large, impersonal office, showing no hostility or bitterness.

Responds with confusion but remains courteous when Papadopoulos mistakenly thinks he is new.
Follows Papadopoulos eagerly after being invited to discuss ideas, showing respectful and eager behavior.
Responds neutrally to Papadopoulos’ personal comment about his daughter, without engagement or warmth.

Successfully completes the task of copying papers and delivers them on time.

Shrugs and offers no information or engagement when asked what else is going on, showing emotional withdrawal or lack of social warmth.

Remains standing confused when told to leave instead of exiting promptly.
Searches his wallet carefully and uses the change machine to get quarters for coffee.
Reports to Harris that he finished the report 'just a little while ago,' indicating timely completion of work.

Shrugs with no explanation when asked what else is going on, showing disengagement or lack of initiative.

Moves quickly and purposefully to his apartment and sets up a lamp and telescope to observe.

Responds to police calmly and directly, sharing information truthfully without evasion.

Responds appropriately to Harris's inappropriate behavior by calling it out.

Pretends to inspect the premises and compliments staff to avoid suspicion.
Insists he works there and tries to explain the situation calmly despite being treated unfairly.

Asks questions about the security check showing awareness of procedure.

Kicks the door causing himself sharp pain but the door opens.

Slumps against the wall in horror, appearing faint and lost, showing emotional overwhelm and lack of control.
